Erik Hanson wrote:

> We have lots of test cases and the entire suite takes way too long to run.
>
> Does anyone know of a tool that will time the execution of each test case so
> we can start refactoring the slowest tests?
>

The JUnit task for Ant will print the elapsed time of each test method when the
plain formatter is used.

Here's an example:

    <target name="test" depends="compile.tests" if="junit.present">

        <junit fork="yes" printsummary="no" haltonfailure="yes">
            <formatter type="plain" usefile="false" />
            <test name="com.xyz.AllTests" />
        </junit>

    </target>

If you want to automatically check whether a test runs within a specific time
limit and fail otherwise, try JUnitPerf:

    http://www.clarkware.com/software/JUnitPerf.html

Mike
